column4: I'm having trouble reaching my wireless gateway, even though I'm connected to the access point. Can anyone help me troubleshoot?
do you have an IP?
how do you get your IP?
yes, I can ping it wired, or wirelessly on my Vista install.
the problem is only a linux issue?
when wired, are you able to ping the gateway?
I am using wicd, and the intellinux drivers.
yes
you use wicd. get an automatic IP via DHCP. You have checked that the IP is normal such as 192.168.x.x and that the subnet is normal such as 255.255.255.0?
Yes, the IP and subnet are correct.
sounds like a problem with the drivers or getting the wireless powered up.  I lean towards the drivers.
with my old laptop. I manually setup using iwconfig and wpaconfig.
How do I do that, and I also don't seem to have a wpaconfig command.
I'm sorry, it is wpa_supplicant.  wpaconfig was the name of the file I created for it to use.
that is only needed when you have your wireless using WPA/WPA2.  which it shoud.
So ow do I configure these manually?
wpa_supplicant takes some patience.  the iwconfig is painless.
I've got a lovely morning sun and a cup of tea.  Bring the ruckus.
start by looking at man iwconfig
I'll come back to you in a few.
how are you coming along?
All set.  I found a bug report that had a module fix for one of my modules that cleaned it right up.
Now I'm tinkering with my microphone, webcam and SD ontroller.
Cool.
